All values are correct and true in both 3.11 and 4.0.

title: CASSANDRA-16789: Add TTL support to nodetool snapshots
CASSANDRA-16663 Request-Based Native Transport Rate-Limiting
body:
This patch adds a global rate limiter for CQL requests for the V3, V4, V5, and V6 protocols. It is configurable in `cassandra.yaml` via `native_transport_rate_limiting_enabled`/`native_transport_requests_per_second` and at runtime via `setNativeTransportRateLimitingEnabled(boolean)`/`setNativeTransportRequestsPerSecond(long)` on the `StorageServiceMBean`.

Both small and large messages are supported, and both back pressure (the default) and throwing on overload are supported.

title: Fix queries on empty partitions with static data (CASSANDRA-16686)
body:
When an CQL query is done at the partition level (without clustering or regular column restrictions), if a partition does not contains any row but contains some static columns a row will be returned to the user with null values for all the clustering and regular columns.
Since CASSANDRA-12768, Cassandra fetch all the regular columns but only the static columns that have been selected by the user. By consequence, Cassandra will fetch only s1 for the SELECT s1 FROM %s WHERE pk=1 query from the description example. Due to that it will NOT attempt to fetch the s2 value and will look only at the third and second SSTables. The partition having no value for s1 Cassandra will consider the partition empty and will not return a row for it as it should. 

The patch fix the issue by adding all the static columns to the fetched columns when the query is at the partition level (without clustering or regular column restrictions). Unfortunately as 4.0-rc1 has been released we need to ensure backward compatibility with it in a mixed cluster environment. To ensure that some extra changes were required in ColumnFilter and in Gossiper.

[CEP-9] Make SSL Context creation pluggable
body:
For details of the change please see the CEP-9: [CEP-9](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/CASSANDRA/CEP-9%3A+Make+SSLContext+creation+pluggable).

JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-16666

Specifically while review I am seeking the Cassandra community input on [this section of the design](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/CASSANDRA/CEP-9%3A+Make+SSLContext+creation+pluggable#CEP9:MakeSSLContextcreationpluggable-ImportantnoteaboutcommonSSLconfigurations).

CASSANDRA-16634 nodetool garbagecollect should retain SSTableLevel
body:
Before this change, garbagecollect would write all output in L0,
  causing a great deal of write amplification and temporary disk
  space use.
  This change causes the output SSTableLevel to match the input,
  making 'nodetool garbagecollect' viable on large LCS tables when
  disk space is tight, and significantly reduces overall resources
  used to complete the operation.
